commands.title: Select a Databricks Asset Bundle target
Deploy the bundle and run a resource
Deploy the bundle and run the job
Deploy the bundle and run the pipeline
Deploy the bundle and select pipeline tables for partial update
Deploy the bundle and validate the pipeline
Debug current file with Databricks Connect
Run current file with Databricks Connect
Reset bundle variables to default values

viewsWelcome.contents:
Multiple Databricks projects were detected in the workspace:
[Choose a project](command:databricks.bundle.selectActiveProjectFolder)

Databricks project configuration was not detected in the root of the workspace:
[Create configuration](command:databricks.bundle.startManualMigration)

A Databricks project was not detected in the workspace:
[Select a project](command:databricks.bundle.selectActiveProjectFolder)

Select a folder where you want to create a new Databricks project using a [template](https://docs.databricks.com/en/dev-tools/bundles/templates.html#databricks-asset-bundle-project-templates):
[Create a new project](command:databricks.bundle.initNewProject)

To learn more about how to use the Databricks extension for Visual Studio Code [read our docs](https://docs.databricks.com/dev-tools/vscode-ext.html) or [Quickstart guide](command:databricks.quickstart.open)

program.description: Absolute path to a python file.

configurationSnippets.label: Databricks: Launch
configurationSnippets.description: A new configuration for running a user selected Python file on Databricks.

program.description: Absolute path to a python file.

parameters.description: Values of the notebook widget parameters as specified by the key of the parameter.

args.description: Command line arguments for Python tasks.

configurationSnippets.label: Databricks: Launch as Workflow
configurationSnippets.description: A new configuration for running a user selected Python file on Databricks as a workflow.

body.name: Run on Databricks as a Workflow

databricks.description: Setup databricks environment variables and globals.
Setup databricks environment variables and globals.

databricks.logs.maxFieldLength.description: The maximum length of each field displayed in logs outputs panel.

databricks.logs.truncationDepth.description: The max depth of logs to show without truncation.

databricks.logs.maxArrayLength.description: The maximum number of items to show for array fields.

databricks.logs.enabled.description: Enable/disable logging. Reload window for changes to take effect.

databricks.clusters.onlyShowAccessibleCl.description: Enable/disable filtering for only accessible clusters (clusters on which the current user can run code)

databricks.overrideDatabricksConfigFile.description: Override location of .databrickscfg file (default: DATABRICKS_CONFIG_FILE environment variable or ~/.databrickscfg)

enumDescriptions: Show cluster view in the explorer.
Show workspace browser in the explorer.

databricks.wsfs.rearrangeCells.description: Enable/disable rearranging cells in wrapper files created when using `workspace` as the sync destination. **Note:** It is recommended to NOT disable this setting. If you do disable it, you will need to manually handle sys.path for local imports in your notebooks.

databricks.connect.progress.markdownDescription: Show PySpark progress bar when using Databricks Connect. Requires `ipywidgets` package and `pyspark@3.5.0+`.

databricks.ipythonDir.description: Absolute path to a directory for storing IPython files. Defaults to IPYTHONDIR environment variable (if set) or ~/.ipython.

databricks.bundle.remoteStateRefreshInte.description: The interval in minutes at which the remote state of the bundle is refreshed.

scripts.vscode:prepublish: rm -rf out && yarn run package:compile && yarn run package:wrappers:write && yarn run package:jupyter-init-script:write && yarn run package:copy-webview-toolkit && yarn run generate-telemetry
scripts.package:all: rm -rf ./.build/ && yarn run package:linux:x64 && yarn run package:linux:arm64 && yarn run package:darwin:x64 && yarn run package:darwin:arm64 && yarn run package:win32:x64 && yarn run package:win32:arm64
scripts.build: yarn run package:wrappers:write && yarn run package:jupyter-init-script:write && tsc --build --force
scripts.watch: yarn run package:wrappers:write && yarn run package:jupyter-init-script:write && yarn run package:copy-webview-toolkit && tsc --build --watch --verbose
scripts.test:integ:extension: yarn run test:integ:prepare && wdio run src/test/e2e/wdio.conf.ts
scripts.test:integ: yarn run test:integ:extension && yarn run test:integ:sdk
scripts.test: yarn run test:lint && yarn run test:unit
